content.description:
Researchers were interested in studying cultural differences in emotional expression. The researchers conducted a study in which all American and Japanese participants watched films of surgery both alone and in the presence of a researcher. Â 
When both American and Japanese participants were alone, they showed the same facial expressions, namely disgust and fear. However, when in the presence of the researcher, the American participants continued to show their negative emotions, while the Japanese participants masked their negative emotions with a smile.
content.question: Which of the following concepts best explains this research finding?
